name: Cell Maps for Artificial Intelligence - March 2025 Data Release (Beta)
description: This dataset is the March 2025 Data Release of Cell Maps for Artificial Intelligence (CM4AI; CM4AI.org), the Functional Genomics Grand Challenge in the NIH Bridge2AI program. This Beta release includes perturb-seq data in undifferentiated KOLF2.1J iPSCs; SEC-MS data in undifferentiated KOLF2.1J iPSCs and iPSC-derived NPCs, neurons, and cardiomyocytes; and IF images in MDA-MB-468 breast cancer cells in the presence and absence of chemotherapy (vorinostat and paclitaxel). CM4AI output data are packaged with provenance graphs and rich metadata as AI-ready datasets in RO-Crate format using the FAIRSCAPE framework. Data presented here will be augmented regularly through the end of the project. CM4AI is a collaboration of UCSD, UCSF, Stanford, UVA, Yale, UA Birmingham, Simon Fraser University, and the Hastings Center. This data is Copyright (c) 2025 The Regents of the University of California except where otherwise noted. Spatial proteomics raw image data is copyright (c) 2025 The Board of Trustees of the Leland Stanford Junior University. Dataset licensed for reuse under Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International license (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/4.0/). Attribution is required to the copyright holders and the authors. Any publications referencing this data or derived products should cite the Related Publication below, as well as directly citing this data collection (2025-03-04). (2025-03-07)
has_files: [CRISPR Perturbation Cell Atlas/ro-crate-metadata.json|CRISPR Perturbation RNA Sequences - Raw Sequences/ro-crate-metadata.json|Protein Localization Subcellular Images/cm4ai-v0.6-beta-if-images-paclitaxel.zip|Protein Localization Subcellular Images/cm4ai-v0.6-beta-if-images-untreated.zip|Protein Localization Subcellular Images/cm4ai-v0.6-beta-if-images-vorinostat.zip|Protein-protein Interaction SEC-MS/ro-crate-metadata.json]
availability_description: This dataset is publicly available for research purposes and licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International license (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/4.0/). All data may be accessed through the UVA Dataverse platform at https://doi.org/10.18130/V3/B35XWX

name: Flagship Dataset of Type 2 Diabetes from the AI-READI Project (Version 2.0.0)
description: The Artificial Intelligence Ready and Equitable Atlas for Diabetes Insights (AI-READI) project seeks to create a flagship ethically-sourced dataset to enable future generations of artificial intelligence/machine learning (AI/ML) research to provide critical insights into type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM), including salutogenic pathways to return to health. The ability to understand and affect the course of complex, multi-organ diseases such as T2DM has been limited by a lack of well-designed, high quality, large, and inclusive multimodal datasets. The AI-READI team of investigators will aim to collect a cross-sectional dataset of 4,000 people and longitudinal data from 10% of the study cohort across the US. The study cohort will be balanced for self-reported race/ethnicity, gender, and diabetes disease stage. Data collection will be specifically designed to permit downstream pseudo-time manifold analysis, an approach used to predict disease trajectories by collecting and learning from complex, multimodal data from participants with differing disease severity (normal to insulin-dependent T2DM). The long-term objective for this project is to develop a foundational dataset in T2DM, agnostic to existing classification criteria or biases, which can be used to reconstruct a temporal atlas of T2DM development and reversal towards health (i.e., salutogenesis). Data will be optimized for downstream AI/ML research and made publicly available. This project will also create a roadmap for ethical and equitable research that focuses on the diversity of the research participants and the workforce involved at all stages of the research process (study design and data collection, curation, analysis, and sharing and collaboration).
availability_description: Access to this data is restricted to authorized users performing research related to type 2 diabetes. More details regarding the approval process may be found on FAIRHub here: https://fairhub.io/datasets/2/access

name: Bridge2AI-Voice: An ethically-sourced, diverse voice dataset linked to health information (Version 1.0)
description: The human voice contains complex acoustic markers which have been linked to important health conditions including dementia, mood disorders, and cancer. When viewed as a biomarker, voice is a promising characteristic to measure as it is simple to collect, cost-effective, and has broad clinical utility. Recent advances in artificial intelligence have provided techniques to extract previously unknown prognostically useful information from dense data elements such as images. The Bridge2AI-Voice project seeks to create an ethically sourced flagship dataset to enable future research in artificial intelligence and support critical insights into the use of voice as a biomarker of health. Here we present Bridge2AI-Voice, a comprehensive collection of data derived from voice recordings with corresponding clinical information. Bridge2AI-Voice v1.0, the initial release, provides 12,523 recordings for 306 participants collected across five sites in North America. Participants were selected based on known conditions which manifest within the voice waveform including voice disorders, neurological disorders, mood disorders, and respiratory disorders. The initial release contains data considered low risk, including derivations such as spectrograms but not the original voice recordings. Detailed demographic, clinical, and validated questionnaire data are also made available.
availability_description: Access to this data is restricted to authorized users who have accepted a data use agreement and completed a training course. Further details are available on Health Data Nexus (see the Files section on this page: https://healthdatanexus.ai/content/b2ai-voice/1.0/)

name: Patient-Focused Collaborative Hospital Repository Uniting Standards (CHoRUS) for Equitable AI (Pre-Release)
description: The goal of the CHoRUS Network is to develop the most diverse, high-resolution, ethically sourced, AI-ready data set to answer the grand challenge of improving recovery from acute illness. This collaboration spans 20 academic centers, of which 14 will contribute as Data Acquisition centers. Patient-focused efforts will determine the ethical and legal approaches to manage privacy and bias, while accounting for Social Determinants of Health. Unified standards will harmonize multi-modal EHR, waveform, imaging, and text data. A visualization and annotation environment will label data with targets important for prediction. A comprehensive set of approaches will develop the skills and workforce for a next generation of diverse academic and community AI scientists. Federated access will enable sampling methods to ensure a balanced and diverse cohort. Collaborating with Bridge2AI and 3 other data generation projects, the CHoRUS Network will help us cross the Bridge2AI network together.
availability_description: Access to this data is restricted to authorized users. Contact the data custodians through the form on this page to request access: https://chorus4ai.org/contact-us/

name: ACRIMA
description: ACRIMA dataset. A new clinical database, ACRIMA, has been made publicly available, containing 705 labelled images. It is composed of 396 glaucomatous images and 309 normal images. Additionally, python scripts used to obtain the presented results are also available. doi:10.1186/s12938-019-0649-y

name: AESDD
description: Acted Emotional Speech Dynamic Database. Speech dataset. ~500 utterances classified by emotion

name: Alliance ingest
description: Alliance of Genome Resources Knowledge Graph. The Alliance of Genome Resources contains a subset of model organism data from member databases that is harmonized to the same model. This is the graph ingest of Alliance data prepared for loading into the Monarch Initiative graph resource.

name: AlphaFold DB
description: AlphaFold protein structure database. AlphaFold DB provides open access to over 200 million protein structure predictions to accelerate scientific research. doi:10.1038/s41586-021-03819-2

name: OCTAGON
description: Angiography by Optical Coherence Tomography segmentation dataset. The OCTAGON dataset is a set of Angiography by Octical Coherence Tomography images (OCT-A) used to the segmentation of the Foveal Avascular Zone (FAZ). The dataset includes 144 healthy OCT-A images and 69 diabetic OCT-A images, divided into four groups, each one with 36 and about 17 OCT-A images, respectively. doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0212364

name: AV Nicking
description: Arteriovenous Nicking dataset. 90 fundus images with annotations for retinal arteriovenous (AV) nicking. doi:10.1109/TBME.2013.2271035

name: AudioMNIST
description: AudioMNIST. 30000 audio samples of spoken digits. doi:10.48550/arXiv.1807.03418

name: Bgee
description: Bgee is a database for retrieval and comparison of gene expression patterns across multiple animal species, produced from multiple data types (bulk RNA-Seq, single-cell RNA-Seq, Affymetrix, in situ hybridization, and EST data) and from multiple data sets (including GTEx data). doi:10.1093/nar/gkaa793

name: BioRED
description: Biomedical Relation Extraction Dataset. Biomedical text relation annotations and labels for novel findings. doi:10.1093/bib/bbac282

name: BioMediTech RPE
description: BioMediTech retinal pigmented epithelium dataset. 195 phase-contrast microscopy images that were divided into 16 subwindows and each subwindow labeled into 4 classes by two trained operators. doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0149399

name: BioScope
description: BioScope corpus. Biomedical texts annotated for negation, speculation and linguistic scope

name: CASIA Iris
description: CASIA Iris Image Database. More than 54,000 external iris images

name: CASIA Iris Subject Ageing
description: CASIA Iris Subject Ageing dataset. More than 26,000 external iris images

name: CATH
description: CATH. A free, publicly available online resource that provides information on the evolutionary relationships of protein structural domains. doi:10.1093/nar/gkaa1079

name: CRAFT
description: Colorado Richly Annotated Full-Text Corpus. Biomedical texts annotated for concepts and linguistic features. doi:10.1007/978-94-024-0881-2_53

name: CHiME
description: Computational Hearing in Multisource Environments Dataset. Recordings of 4 speakers in ~9000 recordings over 4 noisy locations.

name: Coswara
description: Coswara dataset. Respiratory sounds and speech of healthy and COVID-19 positive individuals.

name: CORD-19
description: COVID-19 Open Research Dataset. Biomedical texts with focus on SARS-CoV-2

name: CREMA-D
description: Crowd-sourced Emotional Multimodal Actors Dataset. Speech dataset. 7,442 recordings from 91 actors. doi:10.1109/TAFFC.2014.2336244

name: dbCRID
description: Database of Chromosomal Rearrangements In Diseases. Database of human chromosomal rearrangement (CR) events and their associated diseases. For each reported CR event, dbCRID documents the type of the event, the disease or symptoms associated, and—when possible—detailed information about the CR event including precise breakpoint positions, junction sequences, genes and gene regions disrupted and experimental techniques applied to discover/analyze the CR event. doi:10.1093/nar/gkq1038

name: DECIPHER
description: DatabasE of genomiC varIation and Phenotype in Humans using Ensembl Resources. DECIPHER is used by the clinical community to share and compare phenotypic and genotypic data. The DECIPHER database contains data from 44,062 patients who have given consent for broad data-sharing; DECIPHER also supports more limited sharing via consortia. doi:10/1016/j.ajhg.2009.03.010

name: dbGaP
description: Database of Genotypes and Phenotypes. The database of Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP) was developed to archive and distribute the data and results from studies that have investigated the interaction of genotype and phenotype in Humans.

name: DeepDRiD
description: Deep Diabetic Retinopathy dataset. In DeepDR (Deep Diabetic Retinopathy), the fundus images composed of two parts. One part is from the participants in the Shanghai Diabetic Complication Screening Project (SDCSP), Nicheng Diabetes Screening Project (NDSP), and Nationwide Screening for Complications of Diabetes (NSCD) between 2014 and 2017 for regular fundus images. The other part was captured by a retinal specialist at an Eye Clinic located in Department of Ophthalmology, Shanghai Jiao Tong University affiliated Sixth People's Hospital, China between 2014 to 2017 for regular fundus images and between Jan 2019 to present for ultra-widefield retinal images. From the thousands of examinations available, we have extracted 2000 regular fundus images from 500 patients and 256 ultra-widefield images from another 128 patients to form our dataset. doi:10.1016/j.patter.2022.100512

name: Deeply
description: Deeply Nonverbal Vocalization Dataset. Human nonverbal vocal sound dataset

name: DAPS
description: Device and Produced Speech Dataset. 20 speakers reading 5 excerpts each from public domain books.

name: DRiDB
description: Diabetic retinopathy image database. The Diabetic Retinopathy Image Dataset (DRiDB) has been established to help scientists from around the world to test and develop new image processing methods for early diabetic retinopathy detection in retinal fundus images. doi:10.1109/ISPA.2013.6703830

name: DRIONS-DB
description: Digital Retinal Images for Optic Nerve Segmentation DataBase. The database consists of 110 colour digital retinal images. Initially, it were obtained 124 eye fundus images selected randomly from an eye fundus image base belonging to the Ophthalmology Service at Miguel Servet Hospital, Saragossa (Spain). From this initial image base, all those eye images (14 in total) that had some type of cataract (severe and moderate) were eliminated and, finally, was obtained the image base with 110 images. doi:10.1016/j.artmed.2008.04.005

name: DRIVE
description: Digital Retinal Images for Vessel Extraction dataset. 40 fundus images; annotations for diabetic retinopathy. doi:10.1109/TMI.2004.825627

name: Drishti-GS
description: Drishti-GS dataset. A dataset of retinal images which include both normal and glaucomatous eyes and manual segmentations from multiple human experts. doi:10.1109/ISBI.2014.6867807

name: eICU-CRD
description: eICU Collaborative Research Database. Deidentified, multimodal patient data from ICU stays

name: EmoSynth
description: EmoSynth. 144 audio files labelled by 40 listeners. doi:10.1145/3243274.3243277

name: ESM Atlas
description: ESM Metagenomic Atlas. An open atlas of 617 million metagenomic protein structures. doi:10.1101/2022.07.20.500902

name: ECOD
description: Evolutionary Classification of Protein Domains. A hierarchical classification of protein domains according to their evolutionary relationships. Only proteins with experimentally determined spatial structures from the PDB database are currently classified in ECOD. doi:10.1371/journal.pcbi.1003926

name: FANTOM
description: FANTOM. Ongoing transcriptome analysis project. doi:10.1101/gr.254219.119

name: Duke OCT
description: Farsiu et al. Optical Coherence Tomography dataset. Individual optical coherence tomography images and marking 38400 BScans from 269 age-related macular degeneration patients and 115 normal subjects, their ages, and their corresponding segmentation boundaries on a 5mm diameter centered at the fovea. doi:10.1016/j.ophtha.2013.07.013

name: FSDD
description: Free Spoken Digit Dataset. 4 speakers, 2,000 recordings, 50 of each digit per speaker.

name: G1020
description: G1020 dataset. 1020 high resolution colour fundus images and provides ground truth annotations for glaucoma diagnosis, optic disc and optic cup segmentation, vertical cup-to-disc ratio, size of neuroretinal rim in inferior, superior, nasal and temporal quadrants, and bounding box location for optic disc. doi:10.1109/IJCNN48605.2020.9207664

name: GRCh38
description: GENCODE24 (GRCh38) reference genome. The goal of the GENCODE project is to identify and classify all gene features in the human and mouse genomes with high accuracy based on biological evidence, and to release these annotations for the benefit of biomedical research and genome interpretation.

name: GEMEP
description: GEneva Multimodal Emotion Portrayals corpus. 10 actors portraying 10 states and 12 emotions

name: GIC
description: Genomic Information Commons. A continuously updating, queryable, federated genomic data commons.

name: GTEx
description: Genotype Tissue Expression project. The Genotype-Tissue Expression (GTEx) project is an ongoing effort to build a comprehensive public resource to study tissue-specific gene expression and regulation. Samples were collected from 54 non-diseased tissue sites across nearly 1000 individuals, primarily for molecular assays including WGS, WES, and RNA-Seq. doi:10.1038/ng.2653

name: AudioSet
description: Google AudioSet. dataset of manually-annotated audio events. doi:10.1109/ICASSP.2017.7952261

name: HCUP
description: Healthcare Cost and Utilization Project. The Healthcare Cost and Utilization Project (HCUP) includes the largest collection of longitudinal hospital care data in the United States.

name: HRF
description: High resolution fundus image database. The public database contains at the moment 15 images of healthy patients, 15 images of patients with diabetic retinopathy and 15 images of glaucomatous patients. Binary gold standard vessel segmentation images are available for each image. Also the masks determining field of view (FOV) are provided for particular datasets. doi:10.1155/2013/154860

name: HPOA phenotype
description: HPOA - Disease Annotations. Annotations on Human Phenotype Ontology terms for Orphanet diseases.

name: HPOA genes to phenotype
description: HPOA - Gene to Phenotype Associations. Annotations on Human Phenotype Ontology terms for genes.

name: HPOA phenotype to genes
description: HPOA - Phenotype to Gene Associations. Annotations on Human Phenotype Ontology terms for genes.

name: HCA
description: The Human Cell Atlas (HCA) is an international group of researchers using a combination of these new technologies to create cellular reference maps with the position, function and characteristics of every cell type in the human body. doi:10.7554/eLife.27041

name: HMDB
description: Human Metabolome Database. A freely available electronic database containing detailed information about small molecule metabolites found in the human body. It is intended to be used for applications in metabolomics, clinical chemistry, biomarker discovery and general education. The database is designed to contain or link three kinds of data - 1) chemical data, 2) clinical data, and 3) molecular biology/biochemistry data. doi:10.1093/nar/gkab1062

name: HPA
description: The Human Protein Atlas is a Swedish-based program initiated in 2003 with the aim to map all the human proteins in cells, tissues, and organs using an integration of various omics technologies, including antibody-based imaging, mass spectrometry-based proteomics, transcriptomics, and systems biology. All the data in the knowledge resource is open access to allow scientists both in academia and industry to freely access the data for exploration of the human proteome. doi:10.1126/science.1260419

name: IDRiD
description: Indian Diabetic Retinopathy Image Dataset. Dataset constituting typical diabetic retinopathy lesions and also normal retinal structures annotated at a pixel level. doi:10.3390/data3030025

name: IEMOCAP
description: Interactive emotional dyadic motion capture database. 12 hours of audiovisual data by 10 actors; 5 emotions.

name: InterPro
description: InterPro. InterPro provides functional analysis of proteins by classifying them into families and predicting domains and important sites. doi:10.1093/nar/gkaa977

name: Libri-CSS
description: Libri-CSS dataset. Derived from LibriSpeech by concatenating the corpus utterances to simulate a conversation and capturing the audio replays with far-field microphones.

name: LibriMix
description: LibriMix dataset. Derived from LibriSpeech. Generated, noisy mixes of speech.

name: Librispeech
description: Librispeech. A corpus of ~1000 hours of English speech derived from read audiobooks from the LibriVox project. doi:10.1109/ICASSP.2015.7178964

name: LJ Speech
description: LJ Speech. A public domain speech dataset consisting of 13,100 short audio clips of a single speaker reading passages from 7 non-fiction books, with transcriptions.

name: LGVF
description: Longitudinal Glaucomatous Visual Field data. Longitudinal visual field data of 139 glaucoma patients. doi:10.1167/iovs.13-12492

name: MIDRC
description: Medical Imaging and Data Resource Center. A linked-data commons that coordinates access to data and harmonizes data management activities at three critical stages - (1) intake, including curation, de-identification, abstraction, and quality assessment (2) annotation and labelling of images and other data using semi-automated approaches and (3) distributed access and query methods.

name: MIMIC
description: Medical Information Mart for Intensive Care. Deidentified, multimodal patient data

name: Messidor
description: Methods to Evaluate Segmentation and Indexing Techniques in the field of Retinal Ophthalmology dataset. The 1200 eye fundus color numerical images of the posterior pole of the Messidor database were acquired by 3 ophthalmologic departments. doi:10.5566/ias.1155

name: MicroLib
description: MicroLib. A collection of 3D microstructural datasets assembed using a single 2D input slice as training data. doi:10.1038/s41597-022-01744-1

name: MS-SNSD
description: Microsoft Scalable Noisy Speech Dataset. A noisy speech dataset that can scale to arbitrary sizes depending on the number of speakers, noise types, and Speech to Noise Ratio.

name: WFDB
description: MIMIC Waveform Database for Biomedical Signal Processing. A large collection of physiological signals and measurements from patients in intensive care units, including electrocardiograms, photoplethysmograms, respiration, invasive and non-invasive blood pressure, and more. These measurements and signals are obtained directly from the bedside monitor, and provide a detailed view into the physiology of critically ill patients. doi:10.13026/a2mw-f949

name: Common Voice
description: Mozilla Common Voice data. Spoken text from public domain sources. doi:10.48550/arXiv.1912.06670

name: MSP-Podcast
description: MSP Podcast Corpus. 100 hours by over 100 speakers. doi:10.1109/TAFFC.2017.2736999

name: MSP-IMPROV
description: MSP-IMPROV. 20 sentences by 12 actors; 4 emotions, with video. doi:10.1109/TAFFC.2016.2515617

name: MuSIC data
description: Multi-Scale Integrated Cell data. Two central approaches for mapping cellular structure - protein fluorescent imaging and protein biophysical association - each generate extensive datasets but of distinct qualities and resolutions that are typically treated separately. The MuSIC map is designed to address this challenge, by integrating immunofluorescent images in the Human Protein Atlas with ongoing affinity purification experiments from the BioPlex resource. The result is a unified hierarchical map of eukaryotic cell architecture. In the MuSIC hierarchy, nodes represent systems and arrows indicate containment of the lower system by the upper. Node color indicates known (gold) or putative novel (purple) systems. The size of each circle is based on the number of proteins in the system. The relative height of each system in the layout is determined based on the predicted diameter of the system in MuSIC. doi:10.1038/s41586-021-04115-9

name: MELD
description: Multimodal EmotionLines Dataset. Derived from EmotionLines. Includes more than 1400 dialogues and 13000 utterances from the Friends TV series.

name: NHANES
description: National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey. The National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey (NHANES) is a program of studies designed to assess the health and nutritional status of adults and children in the United States. The survey is unique in that it combines interviews and physical examinations. NHANES is a major program of the National Center for Health Statistics (NCHS).

name: PCORNet Data
description: National Patient-Centered Clinical Research Network data. Clinical data from 9 primary partners.

name: NISQA-Corpus
description: NISQA Speech Quality Corpus. 14k speech samples with simulated background noise and live degradation conditions. doi:10.21437/Interspeech.2021-299

name: NLM-Chem-BC7
description: NLM-Chem BioCreative VII Chemical Identification corpus. 204 full-text PubMed Central (PMC) articles, fully annotated for chemical entities by 12 NLM indexers for both span (i.e. named entity recognition) and normalization (i.e. entity linking) using MeSH. doi:10.1093/database/baac102

name: Noisy
description: Noisy Dataset. Clean and noisy parallel speech database. Also known as VBD, Voice Bank + DEMAND. Speech samples from VCTK dataset. doi:10.7488/ds/2117

name: OARD
description: Open annotation for rare diseases dataset. A real-world-data-derived resource with annotation for rare-disease-related phenotypes. This resource is derived from the EHRs of two academic health institutions containing more than 10 million individuals spanning wide age ranges and different disease subgroups. By leveraging ontology mapping and advanced natural-language-processing (NLP) methods, OARD automatically and efficiently extracts concepts for both rare diseases and their phenotypic traits from billing codes and lab tests as well as over 100 million clinical narratives. doi:10.1016/j.ajhg.2022.08.002

name: OCTID
description: Optical Coherence Tomography Image Retinal Database. An open source Optical Coherence Tomography Image Database containing different retinal OCT images with different pathological conditions. doi:10.48550/arXiv.1812.07056

name: ORIGA-light
description: ORIGA-light dataset. 650 retinal images annotated by trained professionals from Singapore Eye Research Institute. A wide collection of image signs, critical for glaucoma diagnosis, are annotated. doi:10.1109/IEMBS.2010.5626137

name: PAPILA
description: PAPILA dataset. Dataset with fundus images and clinical data of both eyes of the same patient for glaucoma assessment. doi:10.1038/s41597-022-01388-1

name: PD database
description: Parkinson's speech dataset. Recordings from 20 Parkinson's Disease patients and 20 healthy subjects. doi:10.1109/JBHI.2013.2245674

name: PMC OA
description: PubMed Central Open Access Subset. Biomedical texts

name: REFUGE
description: Retinal Fundus Glaucoma Challenge Dataset. 1200 fundus images with ground truth segmentations of the optic disc and optic cup, and clinical glaucoma labels. doi:10.1016/j.media.2019.101570

name: RIGA
description: Retinal fundus Images for Glaucoma Analysis dataset. 750 retinal fundus images. doi:10.1117/12.2293584

name: RIM-ONE DL
description: Retinal IMage database for Optic Nerve Evaluation. 313 retinographies from normal subjects and 172 retinographies from patients with glaucoma. All of these images have been assessed by two experts and include a manual segmentation of the disc and cup. doi:10.5566/ias.2346

name: ROC
description: Retinopathy Online Challenge data. Currently, we have released a first data set, aimed at CAD of microaneurysms and dot hemorrhages. These abnormalities are amongst the first signs of the presence of diabetic retinopathy. doi:10.1109/TMI.2009.2033909

name: RNAseqDB
description: RNAseqDB. The results of a pipeline that processes and unifies RNA-seq data from different studies. Includes processed data from the GTEx and TCGA corrected for study-specific biases, allowing comparative analysis across studies. doi:10.1038/sdata.2018.61\"

name: SEMAINE
description: SEMAINE dataset. 95 dyadic conversations from 21 subjects. Each subject converses with another playing one of four characters with emotions; 5 FeelTrace annotations - activation, valence, dominance, power, intensity.

name: SemMedDB
description: Semantic MEDLINE Database. A repository of semantic predications (subject-predicate-object triples) extracted from the entire set of PubMed citations. doi:10.1093/bioinformatics/bts591

name: GigaSpeech
description: Speechcollab GigaSpeech. 10,000 hours of transcribed audio. doi:10.48550/arXiv.2106.06909

name: Sound Commander
description: Spoken Commands dataset. A database of free audio samples of single-word commands, English pronunciations.

name: SWC
description: Spoken Wikipedia Corpora. Text-aligned spoken Wikipedia articles. doi:10.1007/s10579-017-9410-y

name: DiaRetDb1
description: Standard Diabetic Retinopathy Database Calibration level 1 dataset. 89 fundus images with segmentation and annotated for different diabetic retinopathies. doi:10.5244/C.21.15

name: SCOP
description: Structural Classification of Proteins. The SCOP database, created by manual inspection and abetted by a battery of automated methods, aims to provide a detailed and comprehensive description of the structural and evolutionary relationships between all proteins whose structure is known. doi:10.1093/nar/gkz1064

name: STARE
description: STructured Analysis of the REtina dataset. ~400 raw images. doi:10.1109/TMI.2003.815900

name: SBP Mosiac
description: Subbasal nerve plexus Mosaic images acquired in vivo using laser-scanning confocal microscopy of the cornea in healthy subjects and type 2 diabetes mellitus subjects of the same age. Mosaics represent wide-field images of the plexus incorporating 3D nerve path data projected onto a 2D plane. doi:10.1038/s41598-018-32410-5

name: SUPERFAMILY
description: SUPERFAMILY database. A database of structural and functional annotation for all proteins and genomes. The SUPERFAMILY annotation is based on a collection of hidden Markov models, which represent structural protein domains at the SCOP superfamily level. A superfamily groups together domains which have an evolutionary relationship. The annotation is produced by scanning protein sequences from over 3,200 completely sequenced genomes against the hidden Markov models. doi:10.1093/nar/gky1130

name: SAVEE
description: Surrey Audio-Visual Expressed Emotion Dataset. 4 male actors in 7 different emotions, 480 British English utterances in total, including video of speaker faces.

name: Tatoeba
description: Tatoeba dataset. A database of sentences, translations, and spoken audio for use in language learning. This download contains spoken English recorded by their community.

name: Ted-LIUM
description: Ted-LIUM corpus. Audio talks and their transcriptions available on the TED website.

name: TCGA
description: The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA), a landmark cancer genomics program, molecularly characterized over 20,000 primary cancer and matched normal samples spanning 33 cancer types. doi:10.1038/ng.2764

name: RAVDESS
description: The Ryerson Audio-Visual Database of Emotional Speech and Song. Speech dataset. 7356 files; 24 professional actors vocalizing lexically-matched statements and songs in a neutral North American accent. doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0196391

name: TIMIT
description: TIMIT Acoustic-Phonetic Continuous Speech Corpus. Recordings of 630 speakers of eight major dialects of American English, each reading ten phonetically rich sentences. It includes time-aligned orthographic, phonetic and word transcriptions as well as a speech waveform file for each utterance.

name: TESS
description: Toronto emotional speech set. Speech dataset. 2800 recordings by 2 actresses.

name: VIVAE
description: Variably Intense Vocalizations of Affect and Emotion Corpus. Human non-speech emotion vocalizations.

name: VOiCES
description: Voices Obscured in Complex Environmental Settings Dataset. A speech dataset targeting acoustically challenging and reverberant environments with robust labels and truth data for transcription, denoising, and speaker identification.

name: VoxPopuli
description: VoxPopuli. 100K hours of unlabelled speech data for 23 languages, 1.8K hours of transcribed speech data for 16 languages, and 17.3K hours of speech-to-speech interpretation data for 16x15 directions. doi:10.18653/v1/2021.acl-long.80

name: WHODrug
description: WHODrug medicinal information dictionary. WHODrug contains individual trade names, active ingredients and additional information such as marketing authorisation holder, country of sale, pharmaceutical form and strength. All related medications are linked using a structured WHODrug alphanumeric code, connecting trade names and variation of the ingredient with the active moiety of the ingredient. doi:10.1007/s43441-020-00130-6

name: WikiPathways
description: WikiPathways database. WikiPathways is a database of biological pathways maintained by and for the scientific community. doi:10.1093/nar/gkaa1024

name: DANDI
description: Distributed Archives for Neurophysiology Data Integration. An archive for cellular neurophysiology data including electrophysiology, optophysiology, and behavioral time-series, and images from immunostaining experiments.
